briefdescription.para: Single T-scaling value (either one group or all values =1)
Multiple T-scaling values, need to use T-group indices.
Sets the number of different temperature coupling values.
Do not apply velocity scaling (not a PR-coupling run or step)
Apply velocity scaling using a diagonal matrix.
Sets if to apply no or diagonal Parrinello-Rahman pressure scaling.

detaileddescription.para: Note that this enum is only used in updateMDLeapfrogSimple(), which does not handle fully anistropic Parrinello-Rahman scaling, so we only have options no and diagonal here and no anistropic option.

memberdef.argsstring: (gmx_int64_t step, const t_inputrec *ir)
memberdef.name: isTemperatureCouplingStep

memberdef.argsstring: (gmx_int64_t step, const t_inputrec *ir)
memberdef.name: isPressureCouplingStep

memberdef.argsstring: (int start, int nrend, const unsigned short *particleType, rvec *__restrict v)
memberdef.name: clearVsiteVelocities

briefdescription.para: Sets the velocities of virtual sites to zero.

memberdef.argsstring: (int start, int nrend, real dt, real dtPressureCouple, const rvec *__restrict invMassPerDim, const t_grp_tcstat *tcstat, const unsigned short *cTC, const rvec pRVScaleMatrixDiagonal, const rvec *__restrict x, rvec *__restrict xprime, rvec *__restrict v, const rvec *__restrict f)
memberdef.name: updateMDLeapfrogSimple

briefdescription.para: Integrate using leap-frog with T-scaling and optionally diagonal Parrinello-Rahman p-coupling.

detaileddescription.para:
numTempScaleValues
The number of different T-couple values
applyPRVScaling
Apply Parrinello-Rahman velocity scaling
start
Index of first atom to update
nrend
Last atom to update: nrend - 1
dt
The time step
dtPressureCouple
Time step for pressure coupling
invMassPerDim
1/mass per atom and dimension
tcstat
Temperature coupling information
cTC
T-coupling group index per atom
pRVScaleMatrixDiagonal
Parrinello-Rahman v-scale matrix diagonal
x
Input coordinates
xprime
Updated coordinates
v
Velocities
f
Forces
We expect this template to get good SIMD acceleration by most compilers, unlike the more complex general template. Note that we might get even better SIMD acceleration when we introduce aligned (and padded) memory, possibly with some hints for the compilers.

memberdef.argsstring: (const rvec *r, int index, SimdReal *r0, SimdReal *r1, SimdReal *r2)
memberdef.name: simdLoadRvecs

briefdescription.para: Load (aligned) the contents of GMX_SIMD_REAL_WIDTH rvec elements sequentially into 3 SIMD registers.

detaileddescription.para: The loaded output is: r0: { r[index][XX], r[index][YY], ... } r1: { ... } r2: { ..., r[index+GMX_SIMD_REAL_WIDTH-1][YY], r[index+GMX_SIMD_REAL_WIDTH-1][ZZ] }

parameterdescription.para: Real to an rvec array, has to be aligned to SIMD register width
Index of the first rvec triplet of reals to load

memberdef.argsstring: (rvec *r, int index, SimdReal r0, SimdReal r1, SimdReal r2)
memberdef.name: simdStoreRvecs

briefdescription.para: Store (aligned) 3 SIMD registers sequentially to GMX_SIMD_REAL_WIDTH rvec elements.

detaileddescription.para: The stored output is: r[index] = { { r0[0], r0[1], ... } ... r[index+GMX_SIMD_REAL_WIDTH-1] = { ... , r2[GMX_SIMD_REAL_WIDTH-2], r2[GMX_SIMD_REAL_WIDTH-1] }

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to an rvec array, has to be aligned to SIMD register width
Index of the first rvec triplet of reals to store to

memberdef.argsstring: (int start, int nrend, real dt, const real *__restrict invMass, const t_grp_tcstat *tcstat, const rvec *__restrict x, rvec *__restrict xprime, rvec *__restrict v, const rvec *__restrict f)
